channel.title: I'm soo fucking happy!
channel.description:
OMG, I never expected that getting by getting my laptop stolen I would be a happy man.
Tommorow we're going to but this laptop for me:
[IMG]http://img834.imageshack.us/img834/9076/unleddsn.png[/img]
Quad Core i7-2630QM AAAAAAH 2.0Ghz standard frequency, when Turbo Boost 2.0 is turned on, that goes up to 2.9Ghz, whaaaaaaaa, this is in theory 8 core because of hyper threading so that's even more awesome. Since this is the second and current generation of Intel Core i processors, this has a backup integrated gpu chip aaaaaaaah.
750GB hard drive, numeric keys, bluetooth 6GB DDR3, 17,3 inch Led Screen and my favorite brand Asus!!!!! oh and nvidia 540gt, I have never even dreamed of a laptop like this one. Fuck me.
All that is left now is a hot armenian girlfriend and my company to be succesful and I'll be a happy man. And ofcourse, my when I own my mercedes e classe 220 the newer ones:
[IMG]http://www.roadtaxprices.co.uk/images/2010-mercedes-e-class.jpg[/img]

I’d rather build a desktop. Cheaper, better, faster, and stronger.
[/quote]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PsO6ZnUZI0g&ob=av2e Artists these days steal songs.

inb4taylorswift…

It’s an ok laptop, but as B2300 T4nk said it would most likely be cheaper, better, faster, and stronger to build your on, plus you know were everything came from and how everything is setup since you built it…
[/quote]Thats Kanye West

Daft Punk.

Harder, Better, Faster, Stronger[/quote]

item.title: I'm soo fucking happy!
item.dc:creator: @MistaBigBoss MistaBigBoss
item.description:
@MistaBigBoss wrote:

The Core i series stand out because of their hyperthreading and because of turbo boost. Wich makes them pretty much faster than any other same priced regular desktop cpu.

With turbo boost, the processor looks for what is best for the application and adjusts itself for that. For example, a game that has no multiple core support, what i5 and i7 do is, shut all other cores off and boost the frequency of the active core. Awesome. Hell yeah. And for those who don’t know what Hyper Threading means, it’s when you have 4 cores, but by many complex ways they managed to run 2 threads at the same “time” on 1 core wich gives us 8 logic cores. Let’s say they have an 8 core processor, that makes 16 logic cores.

Read full topic

item.title: I'm soo fucking happy!
item.dc:creator: @shrogg shrogg
item.description:
@shrogg wrote:

Server processors are diferent than Normal processors…
Because server processors are required to have alot of data streaming into them at once and it needs to pump out what is required, and in large quantitys.
just not at the same speeds as mainstream processor.

One of the cheapest i7: $285

newegg.com

Intel Core i7-960 Bloomfield Quad-Core 3.2 GHz LGA 1366 130W BX80601960 Desktop...

Buy Intel Core i7-960 Bloomfield Quad-Core 3.2 GHz LGA 1366 130W BX80601960 Desktop Processor with fast shipping and top-rated customer service. Newegg shopping upgraded ™

AMD Opteron: (8 fucking core server processor) $260

AMD Opteron 6128 Magny-Cours 2.0 GHz 8 x 512KB L2 Cache 12MB L3 Cache Socket G34...

Buy AMD Opteron 6128 Magny-Cours 2.0 GHz 8 x 512KB L2 Cache 12MB L3 Cache Socket G34 115W OS6128WKT8EGOWOF Server Processor with fast shipping and top-rated customer service.Once you know, you Newegg!

Lol Intel.
[/quote]
You’re comparing desktop and server processors. you won’t use 8 cores on regular desktop applications (or games for that matter.)[/quote]

I was comparing the prices. What you can get for what. Yes, obviously you wouldn’t need 8 cores to run most desktop applications or games. Although it’s moving in that direction. Applications are relying less on speed, and more on parallel processing.

On-Topic: Pretty good laptop, mine is similar but lighter + backlit keys + costs less.

item.title: I'm soo fucking happy!
item.dc:creator: @MistaBigBoss MistaBigBoss
item.description:
@MistaBigBoss wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:12, topic:411041”]your company that does what exactly?[/quote]Well I’m going to be a computer engineer (software and hardware) and game developer with the degree I’m going to get, so most likely my company will create software, games, and depending on the success maybe even start research for creating a new platform (console).

Ofcourse I’ll have to work at a company as an engineer to get some money together, but after that I’ll start the company and hire some people to work with me.

If you ever see Vreg Productions on TV in 5-10 years, you’ll know that it was me that created that.

Amen.

Read full topic

item.title: I'm soo fucking happy!
item.dc:creator: @MistaBigBoss MistaBigBoss
item.description:
@MistaBigBoss wrote:

[quote=“B2300 T4nk, post:8, topic:411041”]I’d rather build a desktop. Cheaper, better, faster, and stronger.[/quote]I always said the same but a laptop is different, it’s just, it feels different to own a laptop, I’ve had desktops and laptops before, but I always liked the mobility of laptops.

Plus, this one is extremely cheap, extremely this is the only one I found of that price that has i7, all other laptops of 749 and down are i3 sometimes i5 and they have only cpu integrated graphics and if they have a seperate graphics chip it’s always the AMD 4750 HD, wich is a fucked up chip.

IDK man, this is quad core, this will help me with game development and allow me to use advanced PS3 style graphics, my previous could bearly handle Counter Strike Source, I have never been able to play the newer generation games because my laptop could not run those and because I have no Playstation 3/XBOX 360.

EDIT: Playing those newer games (ps3 graphics) at a friends house is not the same.

Read full topic
